title.rendered: Looking to learn programming from scratch?  Look at the easiest languages

content.rendered:
The industry of programming and application development is more on the agenda than ever. With this we want to tell you that a growing number of users right now want to learn to program their own software projects. The reasons for all this are many, both personally and professionally.

Much of the blame for all this lies with the platforms, services and applications that facilitate this type of task. There are users who launch themselves into the programming sector to achieve personal development, for professional reasons, or to increase their training. The first thing that we must take into consideration is that everything related to the development of programs covers an enormous number of possibilities. Everything will depend on the type of software that we want to develop or how deep we are going to go.

Maybe we just want to learn to create simple programs for your own use, code that is part of larger projects, or even enter the world of games. Once we are clear about where we want to go, we should start by learning the basics of any programming language. This will help us learn the initial concepts of software development, especially if we are going to start programming from scratch. We can use multiple proposals from this team, but we should start with one of the easiest programming languages.

It is not advisable to enter this sector through complex languages ​​that end up making us desperate or boring. It is for all this that we will show you below some of the simplest and easiest languages ​​to learn with which you can start.

The easiest languages ​​to start programming

If you are looking to test your skills related to application development, it is preferable to start learning little by little. These are some of the programming languages ​​especially suitable for beginners.

  • Ruby: if you have zero knowledge in everything related to the software development, this is one of the most interesting proposals you will find. It could be considered as one of the languages ​​to start programming more interesting and affordable. Despite being a veteran proposal, it must be taken into account that from the beginning it was designed to facilitate the arrival of new programmers. This allows us to start understanding structures and running examples from scratch.
  • javascript: on the other hand, we find a proposal that is more than known to most, and which you have surely heard of several times. In addition, it offers us a good number of professional opportunities, so it could be considered as one of the alternatives for learn to program most widespread and used. One point that is very much in its favor is that we will be able to work with this language on all kinds of platforms, both mobile and desktop.
  • python: if you are a complete novice in this sector, Python is one of the proposals that will be more affordable for you. It is generally used in both web and desktop projects and has not stopped growing in recent times. In addition to its simplicity in learning, we must also take into account that this language is very widespread in everything related to artificial intelligence. It is characterized by its object-oriented programming and easy-to-understand structures.
